summary: This bill, the Equity and Inclusion Enforcement Act of 2025 (H.R. 3606), aims to strengthen civil rights protections. It amends Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 to restore the right to individual civil actions related to disparate impact cases. It also mandates that recipients of federal funds designate employees to coordinate compliance efforts and notify individuals of their rights. Additionally, it establishes a Special Assistant for Equity and Inclusion within the Department of Education to promote compliance and advise the Secretary.
